intro: Smyrnium hispidum, commonly known as the hairy cowbane, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Smyrnium hispidum is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks. It is noted for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name.
